title: Livery Band, 1943-46-60, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet)
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Robert Woods Bliss, Dumbarton Oaks Collection
description: Trimming for livery, divided in to three horizontal sections: the top section shows a castle in white on red ground; the center section a coat of arms in several colors; and the bottom section a rampant lion in yellow on a blue ground.
